$schema.description: Pointer to the schema against which this document should be validated.

positionX.description: Horizontal position of control center and notification window

layer-shell.description: Wether or not the windows should be opened as layer-shell surfaces. Note: Requires swaync restart to apply

cssPriority.description: Which GTK priority to use when loading the default and user CSS files. Pick "user" to override XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-3.0/gtk.css

positionY.description: Vertical position of control center and notification window

control-center-positionX.description: Optional: Horizontal position of the control center. Supersedes positionX if not set to `none`

control-center-positionY.description: Optional: Vertical position of the control center. Supersedes positionY if not set to `none`

control-center-margin-top.description: The margin (in pixels) at the top of the control center. 0 to disable

control-center-margin-bottom.description: The margin (in pixels) at the bottom of the control center. 0 to disable

control-center-margin-right.description: The margin (in pixels) at the right of the control center. 0 to disable

control-center-margin-left.description: The margin (in pixels) at the left of the control center. 0 to disable

control-center-exclusive-zone.description: Whether or not the control center should follow the compositors exclusive zones. An example would be setting it to "false" to cover your panel/dock.

notification-2fa-action.description: If each notification should display a 'COPY "1234"' action

notification-inline-replies.description: If notifications should display a text field to reply if the sender requests it. NOTE: Replying in popup notifications is only available if the compositor supports GTK Layer-Shell ON_DEMAND keyboard interactivity.

notification-icon-size.description: The notification icon size (in pixels). The app icon size is 1/3

notification-body-image-height.description: The notification body image height (in pixels)

notification-body-image-width.description: The notification body image width (in pixels)

timeout.description: The notification timeout for notifications with normal priority

timeout-low.description: The notification timeout for notifications with low priority

timeout-critical.description: The notification timeout for notifications with critical priority. 0 to disable

notification-window-width.description: Width of the notification in pixels

fit-to-screen.description: If the control center should expand to both edges of the screen

relative-timestamps.description: Display notification timestamps relative to now e.g. "26 minutes ago". If false, a local iso8601-formatted absolute timestamp is displayed.

control-center-height.description: Height of the control center in pixels. Ignored when 'fit-to-screen' is set to 'true'

control-center-width.description: Width of the control center in pixels

keyboard-shortcuts.description: If control center should use keyboard shortcuts

image-visibility.description: The notification image visibility when no icon is available.

transition-time.description: The notification animation duration. 0 to disable

hide-on-clear.description: Hides the control center after pressing "Clear All"

hide-on-action.description: Hides the control center when clicking on notification action

script-fail-notify.description: Sends a notification if a script fails to run

scripts.description: Which scripts to check and potentially run for every notification. If the notification doesn't include one of the properties, that property will be ignored. All properties (except for exec) use regex. If all properties match the given notification, the script will be run. Only the first matching script will be run.

exec.description: The script to run. Can also run regular shell commands.

summary.description: The summary of the notification. Uses Regex.

body.description: The body of the notification. Uses Regex.

category.description: Which category the notification belongs to. Uses Regex.

run-on.description: Whether to run the script on an action being activated, or when the notification is received.

notification-visibility.description: Set the visibility of each incoming notification. If the notification doesn't include one of the properties, that property will be ignored. All properties (except for state) use regex. If all properties match the given notification, the notification will be follow the provided state. Only the first matching object will be used.

summary.description: The summary of the notification. Uses Regex.

body.description: The body of the notification. Uses Regex.

override-urgency.description: The new urgency of the notification (optional)

category.description: Which category the notification belongs to. Uses Regex.

widgets.description: Which order and which widgets to display. If the "notifications" widget isn't specified, it will be placed at the bottom.

items.$comment: Sadly can't use regex and enums at the same time. Fix in the future?

^title(#[a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,}){0,1}?$.$comment: References the widget structure from "widgets" below

^inhibitors(#[a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,}){0,1}?$.$comment: References the widget structure from "widgets" below

clear-all-button.description: Wether to display a "Clear All" button

dnd.description: Control Center Do Not Disturb Widget

label.description: A generic widget that allows the user to add custom text

text.description: The text content of the widget

mpris.description: A widget that displays multiple music players

image-size.description: The size of the album art

image-radius.description: The border radius of the album art. Will be overriden by setting the border-radius in the style.css for the ".widget-mpris-album-art" class

blur.description: Appy the artwork as the MPRIS background and blur it

buttons-grid.description: A widget to add a grid of buttons that execute shell commands

actions.description: A list of actions containing a label and a command

label.description: Text to be displayed in button

command.description: Command to be executed on click

type.description: Type of the button; toggle buttons receive the .active css class and an env variable 'SWAYNC_TOGGLE_STATE' is set. See example in the default config.json

update-command.description: Command to be executed on visibility change of cc to update the active state of the toggle button (should echo true or false)

active.description: Wether the toggle button is active as default or not

menubar.description: A bar that contains action-buttons and buttons to open a dropdown with action-buttons

^menu(#[a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,}){0,1}?$.description: A button that opens a dropdown with action-buttons

label.description: Text to be displayed in button

position.description: Horizontal position of the button in the bar

^buttons(#[a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,}){0,1}?$.description: A list of action-buttons to be displayed in the topbar

position.description: Horizontal position of the button in the bar

label.description: Text displayed in front of the volume slider

show-per-app-icon.description: Show application icon in per app control

show-per-app-label.description: Show application name in per app control

empty-list-label.description: Text displayed when there are not active sink inputs

expand-button-label.description: Label displayed on button to show per app volume control

collapse-button-label.description: Label displayed on button to hide per app volume control

icon-size.description: Size of the application icon in per app volume control

label.description: Text displayed in front of the backlight slider

device.description: Name of monitor (find possible devices using `ls /sys/class/backlight` or `ls /sys/class/leds`)

clear-all-button.description: Wether to display a "Clear All" button
